page.title: 10Completion of Lavant School
page.content: In 1972 a new school was built in Mid Lavant because the original school built in 1855 was too small.Plans were drawn for the whole school to be built, but because of cutbacks in school building only part of the new school was built. The goverment built extensions to a lot of schools in West Sussex, in the same order as the initial building. The new extension building actually started. The new extension was put off for many years. Then in June 1984 the building actually started. The new extension consists of two classrooms, clockrooms a hall and library. Everyone in school watched the building grow for a year. Then on June 3rd 1985 the extension was finished and Lavant School became one school once more.
